column4: although... strangely, df -h does not show a / or /home mount point
that doesn't seem right
try  fdisk -l
no results
try fdisk -l /dev/hda
I have hda1, 2, and 5
and what do you get when you do   fdisk -l /dev/hda ?
it shows three partitions, hda1, 2, and 5
you were just looking for its size right?
I suppose, mostly just curious why nothing shows up in df -h or mount
i dont know..reboot and see if it recovers
that sounds like a Windows solution :-\
no, sometimes you must..you just started didnt you?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/36233/
can you paste in pastebin your /etc/network/interface file
yes, just a sec
http://www.humanevents.com/article.php?id=14965
give me a chance to look
which interface you want up at boot?
eth1
it wont because of  iface eth1 inet manual  <-- manual
um, that's not what manual means
as you are well aware it wont start at boot noh?
no, it doesn't start *properly* at boot.  it brings the interface up but doesn't start wpa_supplicant, so the roaming doesn't kick off, so it doesn't get the right address and such
